title: How to Make Patatas Bravas

steps.headline: Put a pan over high heat.
Add the potatoes.
steps.description: Cover with water and bring to a simmer. Cook the potatoes until they are just done. This will take about 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove them from the water and put them on a tray to cool.
While they are cooling, add a little oil to the saucepan.
Follow with the onions, garlic and the chillies.
steps.description: Stir them in and cook for a few minutes.

steps.headline: Add the wine, tomatoes, sugar, cumin, paprika and season with salt and pepper.
Stir briefly and cook for 15–20 minutes more, until the liquid has been reduced by half.
Remove it from the heat and let it cool slightly.
While that's cooling, slice a little from the bottom of one potato.
Peel away the skin with your knife.
Half the potato and slice into cubes.
Repeat with the remaining two potatoes.
Process the sauce by pouring the sauce into a blender and pulse a few times.
Then blend on high speed until smooth.
Add mayonnaise and blend until thoroughly combined.
Pour the sauce into a bowl, cover with some plastic wrap and place into the fridge to chill.
Heat the remaining oil in a pan (medium–medium-high).
Add a small batch of the potatoes into the hot oil.
steps.description: Occasionally turn them around with the slotted spoon so they brown evenly. Fry them until golden brown and crispy.

steps.headline: Remove them from the pan and place onto a tray lined with paper towels to drain.
Add another batch of potatoes and fry.
Repeat until all the potatoes are fried.
Season them with a little salt and pepper.
Place the potatoes onto a serving plate.
steps.description: Drizzle some of the spicy sauce on top. Be careful not to drown them!

steps.headline: Your patatas bravas are ready to serve as a snack, or as an alternative spicy side dish!
Finished.

text: Put a pan over high heat.  Add the potatoes. Cover with water and bring to a simmer. Cook the potatoes until they are just done. This will take about 20 minutes. Remove them from the water and put them on a tray to cool.  While they are cooling, add a little oil to the saucepan.  Follow with the onions, garlic and the chillies. Stir them in and cook for a few minutes. Add the wine, tomatoes, sugar, cumin, paprika and season with salt and pepper.  Stir briefly and cook for 15–20 minutes more, until the liquid has been reduced by half.  Remove it from the heat and let it cool slightly.  While that's cooling, slice a little from the bottom of one potato.  Peel away the skin with your knife.  Half the potato and slice into cubes.  Repeat with the remaining two potatoes.  Process the sauce by pouring the sauce into a blender and pulse a few times.  Then blend on high speed until smooth.  Add mayonnaise and blend until thoroughly combined.  Pour the sauce into a bowl, cover with some plastic wrap and place into the fridge to chill.  Heat the remaining oil in a pan (medium–medium-high).  Add a small batch of the potatoes into the hot oil. Occasionally turn them around with the slotted spoon so they brown evenly. Fry them until golden brown and crispy. Remove them from the pan and place onto a tray lined with paper towels to drain.  Add another batch of potatoes and fry.  Repeat until all the potatoes are fried.  Season them with a little salt and pepper.  Place the potatoes onto a serving plate. Drizzle some of the spicy sauce on top. Be careful not to drown them! Your patatas bravas are ready to serve as a snack, or as an alternative spicy side dish!  Finished.
